title: Blockchain
content:
- ### OntologyBlock
  id:: blockchain-ontology
  collapsed:: true
	- ontology:: true
	- term-id:: BC-0001
	- preferred-term:: Blockchain
	- status:: complete
	- public-access:: true
	- definition:: A blockchain is a distributed, cryptographically-secured data structure consisting of an ordered chain of blocks, where each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data, maintained through a consensus mechanism across a peer-to-peer network without requiring a trusted central authority.
	- source:: [[ISO/IEC 23257:2021]], [[ISO/IEC TR]], [[ISO/IEC 23455:2019]], [[ITU-T Y.4460]]
	- maturity:: mature
	- owl:class:: bc:Blockchain
	- owl:physicality:: VirtualEntity
	- owl:role:: Object
	- owl:inferred-class:: bc:VirtualObject
	- belongsToDomain:: [[BlockchainDomain]]
	- implementedInLayer:: [[ConceptualLayer]]
	- #### Relationships
	  id:: blockchain-relationships
	  collapsed:: true
		- is-subclass-of:: [[Distributed Ledger]]
		- is-subclass-of:: [[Distributed Data Structure]]
		- is-subclass-of:: [[Cryptographic System]]

ontology.definition: A blockchain is a distributed, cryptographically-secured data structure consisting of an ordered chain of blocks, where each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data, maintained through a consensus mechanism across a peer-to-peer network without requiring a trusted central authority.
